byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and TRIP GABRIEL

abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton holds meeting with seven ordinary Iowans in town of Monticello, marking both first campaigning excursion and effort of high-profile figure to appear approachable; scores of journalists and other logistical complications attend event, undermining its low-key intent.
lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s first retail campaigning excursion called to mind a celebrity candidate who desperately wants to present an everywoman’s approachability and a news media desperate to cover every aspect of it.

headline.main: For Hillary Clinton, ‘Small’ Events Still Draw a Frenzy of Attention
headline.print_headline: For Clinton, ‘Small’ Events Still Draw a Frenzy of Attention

snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s first retail campaigning excursion called to mind a celebrity candidate who desperately wants to present an everywoman’s approachability and a news media desperate to cover every aspect of it.
